For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1833 Feb. 4, Washington, District of Columbia [to] Adeline Fitzgerald, Dresden, Tennessee / William Fitzgerald
bibl.author: Fitzgerald, William
bibl.note: This is a letter dated February 4, 1833 from William Fitzgerald in Washington, D.C. to his daughter Adeline Fitzgerald in Dresden, Tennessee. He advises her of his improving health, plans of his return home, and admonishes his daughter concerning her endeavors.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: Yours of the 6th ult. I have recd. I am glad to hear my child that you are learning so fast and I see you are improving much in Writing you must persevere and try to excell every girl at school in learning & goodness you must be careful and neat in your attire affectionate to your sister & obedient to your Mother. & preceptor I shall leave here this day four weeks. for Home. I have not had very good health this Winter but am now nearly well.
div1.closer:
Yr. Father W Fitzgerald MissAdeline FitzgeraldDresden Tennessee
Free W Fitzgerald Miss Adeline Fitzgerald Dresden Tennessee City of Washington FEB 4
